column1: in memory of david earl northcutt -- wight| facts. born: march 19
column10: 2015 at jenkins living center. please note: visitation will be 11:30-12:30 p. m. on monday
column13: comes & sogn funeral chapel in watertown followed by graveside services at 1:00 p. m. at mt. hope cemetery in watertown. pastor scott dempster will officiate. david earl northcutt was born march 19
column15: missouri to woodson lee and charlotte elizabeth (carr) northcutt. he grew up in cedar rapids
column16: iowa and graduated from benjamin franklin high school. he worked at western union telegraph and collins radio in cedar rapids. in january
column18: david entered the army air corps (air force) where he did cold weather testing. he was stationed in watertown
column19: south dakota where he met maxine hulsebus. david also was stationed in fairbanks
column20: alaska during the winter. he was honorably discharged in march
column22: california. david and maxine then married on august 9
column23: 1945. the couple made their home in doland
column24: madison and watertown. david was employed at united building center (ubc) for 23 years
column25: retiring in 1985. david is survived by his sister
column26: lucile l. patterson of el cajon
column27: ca. he was preceded in death by his parents; his wife; his 3 year old sister; and brothers
